[

Travel Consultant - Captain's Choice

Company Name APT Travel Group Company Location Level 4, 1230 Nepean Highway , Cheltenham, VIC 3192, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 63 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A snapshot of us & the role:

Headquartered in Cheltenham, APT Travel Group has recently celebrated its 91st birthday and we are showing no signs of slowing down. Boasting an extensive travel portfolio, brands operating under our umbrella include APT, Travelmarvel, Captain’s Choice and Botanica, we are Australia’s largest locally owned tour company and most awarded after all!

Representing the elite Captain's Choice brand, you will join the Guest Relations team as a Travel Consultant with expertise in luxury travel, managing end to end reservations. Working in a small team environment you will be responsible for owning each reservation you take - from creating the booking within the system, to arranging the flights and handling special requests to everything in between! You will be acting as a personal travel consultant to each of our valued passengers and enjoy the luxury of not being required to work to sales targets, to allow yourself sufficient time to really give 110% to each booking, personalising the experience for the customer and providing faultless delivery of each and every reservation.

We currently have two positions within the team. Whether you are a recent graduate looking to break into the travel industry and grow your expertise in luxury travel or an experienced travel consultant, this could be your next move!

\xa0

\xa0

Some of the typical responsibilities of the role are:

  • Selling Captain's Choice exciting range of products
  • Managing each individual reservation from beginning to end
  • Managing inbound phone calls and emails
  • Providing exceptional customer service
  • Converting enquires to bookings
  • General administration

*It’s important to note that you’ll work on a rotating roster with a Saturday shift (9am-2pm) every 4-5 weeks.


What type of skills, background and qualifications would this role require?

We are ideally looking for someone with a passion for luxury travel and the industry as a whole and are open to both applicants with experience within the industry and fresh graduates alike.

Travel Consultants that do well are able to demonstrate exceptional customer service skills, are enthusiastic, enjoy working as part of a team and display strong attention to detail. They exhibit a can do attitude and thrive in a fast paced environment. Strong time management skills and efficiency is a must in this role, where you will be taking on average 15-20 calls per day and managing approximately 30 email enquiries. System training will be provided but air knowledge (such as flight carriers and airline codes) would be advantageous.

\xa0

\xa0In return for your hard work and commitment we provide the following benefits:

  • Amazing staff travel discounts on APT and Travelmarvel products.
  • Join a close knit and supportive team.
  • Participate in regular team building initiatives and games.
  • Social club and wellness program.
  • Want to feel good and do some good in community? Then you can with your 2 annual volunteer days.

\xa0

If you have recently completed a course in travel and are looking to take the next step in your career or are an experienced travel consultant, why wait? Apply today!

Link Health and Community (Link HC) supports people in our community through the provision of General Practice, Dental, Allied Health, Counselling, Volunteer, health promotion services and more recently as the Early Childhood Early Intervention (ECEI) Community Partner of the National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) for Inner and Outer East Metropolitan and Inner Gippsland.\xa0

Associate Director - Research & Strategy

Company Name Charter Keck Cramer Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 104 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Charter Keck Cramer is a Strategic Property Advisory Firm, employing 180 staff across its Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane and Singapore offices. The firm provides a wide range of property services across Research and Strategy, Advisory, Valuations, Projects and Capital.


Position Overview

Charter is seeking to appoint an Associate Director to join its Research & Strategy team, based in Melbourne. This newly created role will assist in leading and growing the recently established Urban Strategy & Cities function.

Drawing on the company’s comprehensive market knowledge, extensive research and related expertise, this role will generate valuable strategic insights and a genuine consulting offering for our clients.


Core Responsibilities:

  • Provide insights to clients about the wide-ranging factors that influence redevelopment and regeneration
  • Translate Charter’s extensive research, knowledge and intellectual property into quality advice for both internal and external clients
  • Advise clients about relationships between development opportunities and infrastructure provision
  • Incorporate practical knowledge of the legislative, organisational and decision-making structures that shape and influence regeneration, planning policy and development within consulting outputs
  • Provide advice that incorporates an understanding and appreciation of the commercial considerations of development delivery, including financing and strategic viability
  • Assist in the development and national growth of the Urban Strategy & Cities work stream
  • Utilise a wide range of qualitative and quantitative data sources and information to understand places, identify issues and recommend solutions.


Position Requirements:

  • Minimum 8 to 10 years’ experience, preferably in a strategic consulting environment
  • Experience in providing high quality analysis and advice on complex tasks relating to research activities, market analysis, property economics, demographics and/or strategic development opportunities, would be advantageous
  • Intermediate Microsoft Office skills and a confident user of technology
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
  • High professional standards with a strong attention to detail
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills with an ability to coach and mentor
  • Commercially astute


If you are looking for a new challenge in a team focused environment, please forward a covering letter, together with Curriculum Vitae to hr@charterkc.com.au.


Charter Keck Cramer is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


For further information, please visit our website at www.charterkc.com.au.

837585779:
[

Front End Engineer - Melbourne

Company Name Global Kinetics Corporation Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 39 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About this role:\xa0


Global Kinetics is currently seeking an experienced Front End Engineer to work in our Melbourne office. \xa0Our work environment is fast-paced, with a collaborative atmosphere. Most of all, we are passionate about delivery innovations that transform the quality of health care and the patient experience. We are looking for like-minded individuals to join our team today.

The focus of this newly created position will be to implement a complete user interface in the form of a mobile and desktop as Angular web app, with an emphasis on security, user-friendliness and performance. Main duties of the role include creating modules and components and coupling them together into a functional app. Artistic design will be initially delivered to you as a guideline, and you will take it to realistic implementation by utilizing your experiences within the estimated time frame. You will work in a team with the back-end developer and communicate with the API using standard methods.\xa0


Key responsibilities:

\xa0\xa0

  • \xa0 Delivering user friendly, complete front-end application that behaves consistently;
  • \xa0 Ensuring high performance on mobile and desktop including cross browser compatibility on supported operating systems;
  • Writing component based reusable code, and building customization for specific use case while maintaining a common UI framework;
  • Maintaining uniform documented front-end code base in JavaScript, HTML and CSS in Angular;
  • Validating user actions on the client side and providing responsive feedback;
  • Writing non-blocking code, and resorting to advanced techniques such as multi-threading, when needed;
  • Writing extensive unit tests in front end code and regularly improve unit test coverage;
  • Creating e2e test suites for all components, and running them with Protractor (or a well-reasoned alternative);
  • Coordinating the workflow between the visual designer, the HTML coder, and yourself;
  • Cooperating with the back-end engineers in the process of building the RESTful API and reduce load to API from front end, wherever possible;
  • Documenting the code inline using JSDoc or other conventions;
  • Maintaining configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments across multiple deployment sites.

\xa0

\xa0

Skills/Qualifications:

\xa0


  • Proficiency with Angular 6, JavaScript and HTML5;
  • Deep knowledge of AngularJS practices and commonly used modules based on extensive work experience;
  • Professional, precise communication skills and ability to participate in defining the end user experience;
  • Ability to create self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components;
  • Ability to ensuring a clear dependency chain, in regard to the app logic as well as the file system;\xa0
  • Extensive knowledge of CSS and JS methods for providing performant visual effects and keeping the framerate above 30fps at all times;
  • Thorough understanding of the responsibilities of the platform, database, API, caching layer, proxies, and other web services used in the system;
  • Experience with building the infrastructure for serving the front-end app and assets.


Interested? \xa0We’d love to hear from you!

\xa0

Please send your CV and a covering letter addressing how you meet the key responsibilities of the role to: recruitment@globalkineticscorp.com

\xa0

Applicants must be Australian or NZ citizens/permanent residents or hold full working rights to be considered.

\xa0

Product Specialist - Melbourne

Company Name Swisse Wellness Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 133 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Longing for a career, not a job, working with a team of people who are dedicated to creating premium quality, scientifically validated natural health products and love making people healthier and happier?


Swisse Wellness could be it!


With over 40 years' experience in the Wellness sector, we are a leading Wellness brand in Australia who currently employee over 300 team members globally. From our vitamins and supplements, to our superfoods, sports nutrition and skincare ranges, when you work for Swisse, you are working across multiple wellness categories, full of premium quality products all formulated to help our customers "Celebrate Life Every Day"!


Our people are the reason we succeed. That’s why they’re our first priority. This informs our culture which is grounded in the belief that if we focus on\xa0PEOPLE,\xa0PRINCIPLES\xa0and\xa0PASSION,\xa0then\xa0PROFIT\xa0will naturally follow.


Our team members love the on-site gym, daily meditation class, flexible working hours, provided team lunches, breakfasts and healthy snacks, ‘CLED’ card rewards, global career opportunities and so much more!


Learn more about life at Swisse on our\xa0LinkedIn Page.


THE ROLE:


As we undergo rapid global growth, investing in the best evidence based natural medicine experts in the business is the highest priority to us.


This valuable team collaborator will be experienced in herbal medicine, natural potent nutrients and evidence based practice. You will be a champion for preventative and natural health solutions and on a mission to improve health and happiness at a global level of influence.


You will have the experience and confidence to influence health care professionals, senior leaders and novice beginners, bringing passion, brilliance and energy to a motivated and professional growing team bursting with new opportunities!


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


  • Visit key retailers to build relationships with education and training in line with Swisse key products and principals.
  • Build relationships and detail clinical research with health care professionals (e.g. Pharmacists), to influence product recommendation and passive endorsement.
  • Implement best practice in store and event training using product education and research to strategically grow sales of key products.
  • Conduct professional booked product trainings in retail and group environments
  • Present wellness product knowledge at Swisse Training events as an ambassador for our products and as an expert presenter
  • Manage and co-ordinate training events aligned with Swisse philosophy and products.
  • Champion innovative market expansion projects from concept, viability, implementing product training programs and measuring results and outcomes.
  • Inspiring product ambassador for all Swisse people, collaborating with State Sales & Business Managers and Territory Mangers to support development, strategy and sales as one team.

EXPERIENCE\xa0AND SKILLS:


  • Tertiary Complementary Health Qualifications – Nutritionist or Naturopath
  • Training and Sales experience, preferably field based
  • At least 2 years’ presenting experience with natural medicine
  • Proven experience as influential and credible Healthcare Practitioner
  • Extensive product knowledge around nutritional and herbal medicine
  • Proven ability to present and influence a large audience with confidence
  • Capability and experience with detailing clinical research with health care professionals
  • Competitive product training and facilitation skills within retail field environment
  • Experience in building relationships with health care providers and KOL’s
  • Exceptional organisational skills
  • Communication, influencing and business management skills
  • Vibrant and approachable

Of vital importance is that you will be a solutions-orientated and self-motivated person who will possess an abundance of positivity, initiative and a passion for making People Healthier and Happier as well as demonstrate Swisse Wellness Team Spirit to "Celebrate Life Every Day!


Does this role sound perfect for you? If so, please 'Apply Now' by submitting your cover letter and CV to the Swisse team.

Works Co-ordinator

Company Name Cushman & Wakefield Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Title
Works Co-ordinator

Job Description

 Job Description Summary

Cushman & Wakefield partner with some of Australia’s most iconic businesses to deliver Facilities, Asset Management and Real Estate Services.

About The Role

The Works Coordinator will review each job passed for review, to determine how the works will be most efficiently processed.

This includes allocating works within a number of different streams, including:
  • A user-pays system, where the business unit directly funds work requests,
  • Aligning works with existing planned maintenance activities,
  • Grouping works to minimize the total number of visits to sites, and reduce overall travel requirements, or
  • Deferring or declining the works
The Works Coordinators will be responsible for reporting on job reviewed, and provide analysis on the volume of jobs re-allocated, potential cost savings, and track KPI performance. Based in Melbourne, and have a National scope and will be responsible for allocating works into the above listed categories, having authority to allocate or cancel works with a pre-approved value.

Job Purpose

The key objective of the Works Coordinator role is to review low priority works requests and determine the most suitable response for the works, with the aim of minimizing expenditure on non-critical activities.
  • The volume of work requests processed,
  • The allocation of work requests within standard response & rectification KPIs, and
  • The total cost savings generated through the correct allocation of works.
To be successful in the role, the Works Coordinator requires:
  • A basic to intermediate understanding of Facilities Management practices
  • Experience with JDE E1
  • Intermediate to high level Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent time and organizational management
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
To be successful in the role, the Works Coordinator should:
  • Be well presented, reflecting the corporate office environment the role operates within,
  • Have a strong work ethic, with the ability to process large volumes of work orders
  • Be able to work independently, with minimal supervision, and
  • Be reliable and perform consistently.
To join the Cushman and Wakefield team, submit your application today using the APPLY button below.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Cushman & Wakefield encourages indigenous Australian and female candidates to apply.

Cushman & Wakefield provides equal employment opportunity. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. Cushman & Wakefield is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment withoutregard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law.

Company Name Talent Nation Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 74 views

Job description

Recruitment Coordinator

Melbourne, VIC

\xa0

The company

\xa0

At Talent Nation we are committed to using the power of business to do good, our primary objective being to match purpose driven people with purpose driven roles. Combining our passions and expertise, we specialise in the executive search and recruitment of professionals within the fields of Environment, Sustainability, Energy, Natural Resources, Safety, Renewables, Social Enterprise and Not for Profits. We are constantly engaging with all levels of leaders, and as a result helping to implement positive and effective social, environmental and economic outcomes for both the organisations themselves as well as the broader community.

\xa0

The role

Talent Nation is currently seeking a highly capable Recruitment Coordinator to join our close-knit team. You will be responsible for assisting in the end to end recruitment process for a range of executive, senior executive positions and impact driven recruitment assignments.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Providing administrative recruitment support
  • Report writing and editing
  • Managing enquiries from clients and candidates
  • Processing resumes and managing the recruitment database
  • Uploading online job advertisements
  • Assistance with marketing functions including social media
  • Ad hoc projects as per business requirements

\xa0

About you

\xa0

You will be a proactive team player with initiative, who wishes to progress in a recruitment career and whom also has values aligned with the environmental and social spaces that we specialise in.


Ideally, you will possess:

  • Relevant tertiary qualifications or a minimum of 2 years professional experience
  • Advanced knowledge of the suite of Microsoft Office programs
  • Highly developed written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
  • Strong organisational skills and high attention to detail
  • Ability to work autonomously and within a team environment
  • Ability to work under pressure and complete tasks within set deadlines

\xa0

\xa0

The rewards

\xa0

Working with Talent Nation means the opportunity to be involved with a founding Certified B Corporation within Australia. If you are looking for a profit driven organisation that only cares about the bottom-line then we are not right for you. We love the work that we do and the people we interact with; including our partners that we support through our probono work and financial contributions. We consider the impact of our decisions not only on our shareholders, but also on our stakeholders which include the community, the environment, our staff, suppliers and customers. You spend a lot of time in your workplace, so it is our belief that you have to enjoy where you work and be proud of what you do. We are looking to invest in, support and develop the right individual for a long-term career within the company and industry.

We are unashamedly proud of the fact that we are the market leaders in this space and are constantly humbled by the actions of the people and organisations we support. If you would like to grow your career, and leverage your skills to create impact, then we would love to talk to you.



To apply

\xa0

We believe that ‘Purpose’ is a critical component in job satisfaction. Therefore to be considered for this role, we ask that you provide a Cover Letter detailing your interest in the role and the sectors that we operate in.

\xa0


For a confidential discussion contact Richard Evans on 0431 414 883. Please direct any general enquiries to apply@talentnation.com.au

\xa0

\xa0

BAE Systems Australia is a global Defence and security company with wide-ranging products and services to support and protect Australia’s Defence forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology, and support services.

\xa0

As the Resource Planning Analyst, you will work closely with the business leaders and will utilise your resource planning expertise to help the Maritime Sustainment business achieve its commercial and strategic objectives. This challenging and rewarding position will be based at our office in Williamstown, Victoria and will be offered on a 16 month fixed term and full time contract basis.

Merchandise Planner - Apparel and General Merchandise

Company Name Kmart Australia Limited Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Kmart, families come first for the lowest prices on everyday items, and our vision is to make everyday living brighter for all of our customers, every time and everywhere they shop with us.

As Australia’s brightest retail star, we have experienced great success in recent times but for Kmart this is just the beginning of our exciting journey ahead! We have big plans in place to ensure we deliver our vision and significantly expand our business. With another 40 new stores opening across Australia and New Zealand, the growth of our online business and expansion into new markets, we are on a mission to improve the Kmart shopping experience for all our customers, who are at the heart of everything we do. There has never been a more irresistible time to join Kmart!

Due to growth in our Planning team we are now seeking to recruit Merchandise Planners across our apparel and general merchandise portfolios.

Based at our Head Office in Mulgrave and reporting into a Planning Manager, in this role you will:

  • deliver key profit objectives through innovation, customer orientation, inventory management and analysis
  • work closely with your buyer and the broader team
  • be a significant contributor in executing the strategy
  • trade your business to maximise every opportunity and minimise risks
  • control a significant Open to Buy
  • forecast stock requirements to maximise revenue, margin and stock turn performance

Irresistible You!

As an experienced Merchandise Planner, you will have a solid knowledge base, an inquisitive and commercial mind and enjoy knowledge sharing. Working collaboratively is your preferred style but you are comfortable owning your business and decision making.

Driven to succeed, you have demonstrated business acumen and exceptional commercial results; excel in forecasting, interpreting market trends and executing strategic trading plans to exceed targets and deliver growth.

You are a well-regarded trader, strong communicator and influencer, with a proactive approach. Strong computer literacy, including proficiency in Excel is essential.

Irresistible Kmart!

We are a huge volume retailer and we do things a little differently around here! We will support you in learning the Kmart way but we will also give you the accountability and ownership you crave. Kmart is a company that will give you the opportunity to gain experience outside of your comfort zone, where you can develop professionally and truly own your career!

You will benefit from joining an amazing business and a dynamic team who are all committed to the success of Kmart and providing our customers with a great shopping experience. Our values – Think Customer, Take Care, Live Integrity, Grow Together and Reach Higher will resonate with you deeply and you’ll enjoy being part of a growing, iconic Australian business that has a fantastic culture that is non-hierarchical, diverse and inclusive. Your work environment will be highly collaborative, fast-paced and progressive, with no two days the same!

You will be afforded autonomy and accountability in your role and have access to development opportunities across both Kmart and the Wesfarmers Group, excellent remuneration, an uncapped bonus scheme & access to Wesfarmers share plan (both for eligible team members), free parking and benefits program including a discount card for Kmart, Coles, Target and Officeworks.

So if this sounds like the perfect role for you – apply now!

At Kmart we aim to ensure our teams reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.

Candidates interested in this position should apply directly to this advertisement as we are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

Health and Safety Manager

Company Name City West Water Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 97 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Lead and drive initiatives that support a safety first culture
  • Collaborative, diverse, high-energy team environment
  • Access to flexible working arrangements


The organisation

Based in Melbourne’s CBD fringe, City West Water provides world-class clean drinking water and sewerage services to over one million customers and 40,000 businesses in Melbourne’s CBD and the growing western suburbs. We are proud to serve the city that has been awarded world’s most liveable time and time again, and are working hard to support our customers through the challenges of population growth and a changing climate.

We are creating an organisation that is as vibrant and diverse as the community we serve, as we recognise that our people are our greatest asset.

The opportunity

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, we are seeking an energetic, creative and driven individual to head the Health and Safety team. You will be at the forefront of ensuring City West Water implements a clear vision and strategy on providing a safe working environment, equipment and processes for employees, contractors and our customers.

The position is responsible for ensuring that the strategic principle ‘we live and breathe safety and wellbeing’ is put into practice, contributing to the successful implementation of the corporate strategy for City West Water.

The Position Is Critical To
  • Implementing a clear vision for health and safety that the organisation strives towards, and implementing a detailed forward-looking strategy to ensure the health and safety of all;
  • Timely and effective decision-making in relation to health and safety risks;
  • Clear communication of health and safety strategic direction, standards and initiatives; and
  • Ensuring the health, safety and wellbeing of all staff and contractors.


What You’ll Bring To The Role
  • Practical hands on experience in implementing and leading a clear H&S vision and strategy
  • Demonstrated experience in the implementation and improvement of H&S strategies and AS/NZS 4801-certified management systems
  • Proven ability to lead, coach and manage a diverse and specialised team
  • Exceptional communications skills with the ability to establish and maintain relationships with stakeholders
  • An ability to influence and work with client groups, including senior leaders
  • Qualifications in H&S or extensive experience in H&S
  • Ability to work to tight deadlines in a fast paced environment
  • A safety and customer first mentality.


What We Offer In Return
  • An attractive and competitive remuneration package
  • Flexible working arrangements, including Work Life Balance and leave options
  • A focus on wellbeing (health insurance, flu vaccinations, skin checks)
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program
  • Salary Continuance and Life Insurance
  • Commuter Club-discounted Myki
  • A centrally located office in vibrant Footscray, just 10 minute drive, or two train stops, from Melbourne’s CBD.


We have an inclusive working environment with employees from a variety of backgrounds. We acknowledge that diversity at City West Water increases the effectiveness of teams and our capacity for innovation. We welcome applications from Indigenous people, workers of all ages, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of the application so we can assist you through the recruitment process.

Job description

Do you want to coach people to finally lose weight forever\xa0and transform their whole life?

\xa0

Do you want access to a new ground-breaking evidence-based scientific program that is not about fads, pills, powders, diets or challenges?

\xa0

You\xa0can\xa0become\xa0a\xa0Sum\xa0Sanos\xa0Coach\xa0and\xa0deliver\xa0a\xa0proven\xa0coaching program\xa0that is set to establish a new standard in\xa0weight\xa0management globally.

\xa0

Despite the significant increase in the volume of pills, potions, diets and challenges stealing our attention and consuming our lives, statistics on weight gain and obesity continue to grow – in fact, globally 54% of adults are classified as overweight or obese.

\xa0

What’s\xa0worse\xa0is\xa0that\xa0most\xa0people\xa0who\xa0HAVE\xa0lost\xa0weight\xa0using\xa0these methods, regain\xa0all\xa0or\xa0more\xa0of\xa0the\xa0weight\xa0they\xa0lost\xa0after\xa0twelve\xa0months.

No\xa0Focus\xa0on\xa0Diet\xa0or\xa0Exercise

\xa0

No\xa0Pills, Powders\xa0or\xa0Challenges

Sum\xa0Sanos\xa0Makes\xa0Running\xa0Your\xa0Own\xa0Wellness\xa0Coaching\xa0Business\xa0a Breeze

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 access to program materials and resources

  • Calling all HR Graduates ready to kick-start their career

Simplot Australia is a vibrant, sustainable provider of great food in Australasia. Home to Australia's favourite food brands, Simplot manufactures a diverse range of products that includes everything from delicious and balanced meals, convenient frozen potato and vegetables, tasty pasta sauces and nutritious seafood to fun snack foods. Our portfolio of brands consist of Birds Eye, Edgell, Leggos, John West, Top Cut, Seakist, Harvest, Chiko, I&J, Ally, Lean Cuisine, Five Tastes, Chicken Tonight, Raguletto and Five Brothers. Simplot is owned by the JR. Simplot Company and has grown to become a multinational agriculture and food business with annual sales of more than $US5 billion.

Reporting To The Executive Director Human Resources & Transformation And Located In Mentone, In The SE Suburbs, You Will Support The HR Team By

An exciting opportunity has been created for an HR Graduate to join our corporate Head Office.
  • Diary and travel management for the Executive Director, HR&T;

  • Assisting with the development and maintenance of HR content for presentations, the intranet and social media;

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills; and
  • A proactive and flexible attitude, always providing a high level of customer service.

Working across a diverse HR team this is the opportunity you have been looking for where you can build your career for the future.

845644656:
[

Client Solutions Manager

Company Name Facebook Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 43 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.

The Client Solutions Manager for Facebook's Global Marketing Solutions team is a strategic and enthusiastic solution-driver who puts our customers at the core of everything we do. This is an outstanding opportunity to build and manage key relationships, be a platform and product expert, and become an expert in media planning, strategy and measurement to our Fortune 500, multi-channel advertisers. With proven understanding of both online and traditional media, this role is responsible for partnering with the sales team to develop industry-specific relationships, drive revenue by negotiating and optimizing complex opportunities, and use data and analytics to build a consultative solution for our customers.

The Client Solutions Manager will establish and strengthen key client relationships with a focus on driving revenue, advertiser education & advertiser satisfaction. Success in this position requires strong consultative sales, analytical, and technical skills, a focus on client service, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment delivering against tight deadlines.
This role is full time, based out of our Melbourne office.

Responsibilities
  • In partnership with the Client Partner, you will be delivering strategic revenue growth from the advertisers you will be working with.
  • Media Planning, Strategy & Measurement, and Optimization:
    • Outlines measurement solutions and appropriate campaign structures based upon key KPI’s.
    • Manages and consults on complex advertising solutions and integrations.
    • Manages revenue delivery and budget spend, including daily optimization and providing real time targeting recommendations.
  • Platform & Product Expert:
    • Articulate and update clients on FB product and developments.
    • Responsible for educating clients and agencies on best practices.
    • Drives product innovation based upon client needs.
    • Build and manage relationships with key clients and agency partners (media, creative, FMP, etc.).
  • Project Management:
    • Manage complex work streams to optimize marketing objectives for clients.
    • Manage Analytics and dashboards to advise clients (e.g. daily client facing data/insights reporting, understanding performance across hundreds of accounts used by client, setting up pipelines to pull conversion and impression data, etc.)
    • Cross-functional collaboration of all projects.
  • Relationship Management:
    • Oversee delivery and revenue recognition for the businesses/accounts you are assigned to.
    • Identify up-sell opportunities across your accounts and partner with the Client Partners to drive incremental revenue
    • Experience with the Facebook family of apps.
Minimum Qualification
  • BA/BS degree preferred BS in Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Physics, Stats, Economics or business but with a focus on analytics.
  • 5+ years’ experience working directly with marketing, media and/or consulting companies and demonstrated leadership experience required.
  • Experience with the industry or business trends in the industry (Direct Response marketing, data and technology solutions, ad-tech, partnerships, CRM)
  • Experience working effectively with XFN teams and all levels of management (internally and externally)
  • Advanced Excel skills, experience with analyzing data-sets and delivering actionable insights.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining strict attention to details.
  • Ability to communicate, collaborate and work effectively on a team.
  • Ability to confidently present to build ongoing relationships with external clients.
  • Understanding of major advertising success metrics.
  • Understanding of the app technology and app technology landscape.
  • Extensive experience as a Facebook user and familiarity with Facebook’s ad solutions preferred.

Industry

  • Internet

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Business Development
  • Sales

Talent Acquisition Consultant- Legal/Risk (Sydney/Melbourne)

Company Name KPMG Australia Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate, share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges, empower change, drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients, our firm and our communities.

Our People, Performance & Culture team deliver seamless human resources solutions to the business. Our vision is to improve people’s lives at KPMG and beyond. Our passion and purpose to achieve our vision is shared, and has been a key pillar in our Strategy to build a world class people experience to become the clear choice for our people, clients and communities.

The KPMG Australia's National Talent Acquisition (TA) Team partner with key stakeholder groups to hire for a broad range of vacancies. TA focus on building exceptional relationships with stakeholders and delivering proactive solutions to attract a diverse talent pool.

Your Opportunity

As part of the national People, Performance & Culture (PPC) Team, you’ll be responsible for delivering recruitment sourcing strategies and building key relationships with the firm's senior leadership. Your key accountabilities will include

  • End to end management of experienced recruitment for a broad range of service lines
  • Building relationships with senior leaders
    Proactively building talent pools to enhance diversity and our capability to respond quickly to business growth and emerging workforce needs
  • Attend relevant TA, PPC and business events and provide support as required
  • Identify potential TA process improvements and contribute to TA Projects
  • Working collaboratively with our resourcing teams, HR Business Partners and the broader PPC teams to deliver a high quality and seamless service to stakeholders

How are you Extraordinary?

At KPMG, we believe diversity of thought, background and unique experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities.

To be considered for this opportunity, your qualifications, skills & experience could include

  • Legal/Risk or Professional Services recruitment experience
  • End to end experience in recruitment processes
  • Experience in sourcing and screening of applicants through a variety of assessment tools
    Ability to establish good networks
  • Experience in agency recruitment as well as an in-house environment will be advantageous
    Exceptional stakeholder relationship skills with the ability to develop trust and credibility at senior levels
  • Highly organised and the ability to work under pressure with competing priorities
  • A passionate people person with exceptional communication and the ability to engage and influence others

The KPMG Difference

Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences, qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.

We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women, and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.

Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work, personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG
